When this town was first founded it was originally named Westdale. It was named in honor of painter Benjamin West, who was one resident of the early  of the town. When Swarthmore College was established the name was changed to Swarthmore.
Swarthmore is located off Exit 3 of Interstate 476 (or locally known as the "Blue Route"). Swarthmore can also be accessed by State Route 320 or State Route 12 (Baltimore Pike)
SEPTA Route 109 bus connecting Upper Darby, PA and Chester, PA stops along Chester Road.
SEPTA Regional Rail trains (R3 Line) stop at Swarthmore Station, located in the heart of the village
is minutes from Swathhmore and is served by taxis and the SEPTA R1 Regional Rail Line.
Swarthmore is a small, compact borough where walking and/or biking is a viable option. There is a Philly CarShare spot located at the train station.

value: content= A liberal arts college located in the heart of Swarthmore. Swarthmore College has been named a "Little Ivy" by various college guides, and is ranked third best Liberal Arts College in the United States by
. The school also maintains the 357-acre Scott Arboretum, a beautiful park open to the public without charge.

value: A grocery store specializing in high-quality (but expensive) food. Owned by community members as a Co-Op
This store provides a wide variety of dried fruits, nuts, candies, cookies, crackers and other snack foods. They also have freshly roasted coffee beans and other bulk items.
